conditions.title: Low Back Pain
conditions.description: One of the most common musculoskeletal conditions affecting the lower spine, causing pain and limited mobility. Can be acute or chronic, with various causes including poor posture, muscle strain, and disc problems.

conditions.title: Stroke Rehabilitation
conditions.description: Comprehensive rehabilitation program for individuals recovering from stroke. Focuses on regaining motor function, balance, coordination, and independence in daily activities.

conditions.title: Sports Injuries
conditions.description: Injuries occurring during sports or exercise, including sprains, strains, fractures, and overuse injuries. Requires specialized rehabilitation to ensure safe return to activity.

conditions.title: Osteoarthritis
conditions.description: Degenerative joint disease characterized by breakdown of cartilage. Commonly affects knees, hips, hands, and spine. Physiotherapy helps manage symptoms and maintain function.

conditions.title: Neck Pain
conditions.description: Pain in the cervical spine region, often caused by poor posture, muscle strain, or degenerative conditions. Can cause headaches and radiate to shoulders and arms.

conditions.title: Frozen Shoulder
conditions.description: Also known as adhesive capsulitis, this condition causes stiffness and pain in the shoulder joint. Typically progresses through freezing, frozen, and thawing stages over months to years.

conditions.title: Sciatica
conditions.description: Pain radiating along the sciatic nerve from the lower back through the hip and down the leg. Often caused by a herniated disc or bone spur compressing the nerve.

conditions.title: Knee Injuries
conditions.description: Common injuries affecting the knee joint, including ligament tears (ACL, MCL), meniscus injuries, and patellofemoral pain syndrome. Affects athletes and general population alike.
